ConnectionWeightScale

The maximum connection weight scale/magnitude. E.g. a value of 5 defines a weight range of -5 to 5. The weight range is strictly enforced, e.g. when creating new connections and mutating existing ones.

Declaration
public double? ConnectionWeightScale { get; init; }
Property Value
Type Description
double?
| Improve this Doc View Source

CyclesPerActivation

For cyclic neural networks (i.e. if IsAcyclic is false) this defines how many timesteps to run the neural net per call to Activate().

DegreeOfParallelism

The number of CPU threads to distribute work to. Set to -1 to use a thread count that matches the number of logical CPU cores.

EnableHardwareAcceleratedActivationFunctions

Enable use of hardware accelerated neural network activation functions, i.e. alternative implementations that use CPU SIMD/vector instructions.

Declaration
public bool? EnableHardwareAcceleratedActivationFunctions { get; init; }
Property Value
Type Description
bool?
Remarks

The vectorized code is provided by alternative classes, and these classes tend to be more complex than their 'baseline' non-vectorized equivalents. Therefore when debugging a problem it is often useful to disable use of all vectorized code in order to rule out that code as the source of a problem/bug.

Furthermore, enabling hardware acceleration has been observed to often result in slower execution speed, probably because NEAT deals with non-homogeneous, irregular neural network structures that are generally not conducive to the application of vectorized code.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Remarks

The vectorized code is provided by alternative classes, and these classes tend to be more complex than their 'baseline' non-vectorized equivalents. Therefore when debugging a problem it is often useful to disable use of all vectorized code in order to rule out that code as the source of a problem/bug.

Furthermore, enabling hardware acceleration has been observed to often result in slower execution speed, probably because NEAT deals with non-homogeneous, irregular neural network structures that are generally not conducive to the application of vectorized code.

InitialInterconnectionsProportion

The initial interconnections proportion. This is the proportion of possible direct connections from the input nodes to the output nodes that are to be created in each initial/seed genome. The connections to create are selected at random (using a select-without-replacement method).

Declaration
public double? InitialInterconnectionsProportion { get; init; }
Property Value
Type Description
double?
| Improve this Doc View Source

IsAcyclic

A boolean flag that indicates if the genomes that are evolved are acyclic, i.e. they should have no recurrent/cyclic connection paths.
